item.description:
Here's the link: http://www.pacificore... . I think that after our outing at "THE PLACE" in Guilford, this will be a nice contrast. I hear the food is wonderful and MOST importantly they have Key Lime Tarts for desert!! I have set the limit at 8 people but the restaurant tells me that if the response is strong I can increase that a bit, so please RSVP early so I can get a sense of the interest. I've set the time early at 6PM since it is a Sunday. Here are some typical reviews:

“There is a deliciously lively air to the place — due in no small measure to the excellent mojitos — and the people are having too good a time to be restrained by convention…In short, Pacifico is a find. It is just a millimeter short of excellence, and that will not be long in coming."
– The New York Times, June 25, 2005

"Chef Rafael Palomino is an exciting talent, riding the curling edge of a Nuevo Latino wave.”
– Westchester Weekly, May 31, 2001

"The warm, human buzz in the two-floor-high space plays off the colors and the open kitchen to create an emulsion of atmosphere that is more than the sum of its parts."
– The New Haven Advocate, March 2004

"There’s nothing passive about Pacifico. The place is as vibrant as a samba, slinky as a tango, sexy as a cha-cha in double time.The all-important corner of College and Crown is alive again — hooray!"
—EntertainmentCTCentral.com
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for the New Haven Dining Out Group

group.name: The New Haven Area Dining Out Group

item.name: Pacifico - Cervezas, Mojitos, Tapa's --- and so much more.
